bropals.lib.simplegame.io

Class AssetLoader<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.io.AssetLoader<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of assets that this AssetLoader will load.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BufferedImageLoader, MusicLoader, SoundEffectLoader

    public abstract class AssetLoader<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Super class for all asset loaders.

      • add

        protected void add(java.lang.String key,
                   T asset)
        Puts an asset into this AssetLoader's assets cache.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to store the asset at
        asset - the asset to add

      • getAsset

        public T getAsset(java.lang.String key)
        Gets a loaded asset from this AssetLoader.
        Parameters:
        key - the key the asset was stored as
        Returns:
        the loaded asset

      • getAssetManager

        public AssetManager getAssetManager()
        Gets the AssetManager that this AssetLoader is inside.
        Returns:
        the AssetManager that this AssetLoader is inside.

      • loadAsset

        public abstract void loadAsset(java.lang.String key,
                               java.io.InputStream inputStream)
        Loads an asset from an InputStream. Implementations of AssetLoader must, at some point, add the asset loaded form the input stream to this AssetLoader as the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to store the asset as
        inputStream - the input stream to load the asset from

      • loadAsset

        public void loadAsset(java.lang.String key,
                      java.io.File file)
        Loads an asset from a file.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to store the asset as
        file - the file to load the asset from.

      • loadAssetFromURL

        public void loadAssetFromURL(java.lang.String key,
                             java.net.URL url)
        Loads an asset from a URL.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to store the asset as
        url - the URL to load the asset from

      • unload

        public void unload(java.lang.String key)
        Removes the asset with the specified key from memory.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the asset to remove
